arabicText: حمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(*Alphabets of the Arabic 
language; Allah and to whomever He 
reveals, know their precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(*Arabi zabān ke huroof jin ke 
ma’āni Allah aur jis par Allah ne inko nazil 
farmaya Wahi jānta hai.)

arabicText: وَٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	clear	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	clear	Qur’an.

arabicText: إِنَّا جَعَلْنَـٰهُ قُرْءَٰنًا عَرَبِيًّۭا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	sent	it	as	a	Qur’an	in	the	
Arabic	language,	so	that	you	may	
understand.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	usey	Arabi	Qur’ān	utārā	ke	tum	
samjho

arabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ فِىٓ أُمِّ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَدَيْنَا لَعَلِىٌّ حَكِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Qur’an	is	undoubtedly,	in	the	
Original	Book	with	Us,	surely	the	exalted,	full	of	wisdom.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	woh	asl	Kitāb	meiñ	hamāre	
pās	zaroor	bulandi	wa	Hikmat	wālā	hai.

arabicText: أَفَنَضْرِبُ عَنكُمُ ٱلذِّكْرَ صَفْحًا أَن كُنتُمْ قَوْمًۭا مُّسْرِفِينَ
englishTranslationText: So	shall	We	divert	the	advice	away	from	you,	because	you	are	a	nation	that	exceeds	the	limits?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kiyā	ham	tum	se	ƶikr	kā	pahlu	pher	deñ	is	par	ke	tum	log	ḥad	se	badhne	wāle	ho

arabicText: وَكَمْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن نَّبِىٍّۢ فِى ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	how	many	Prophets	We	did	send	among	the	earlier	people!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	ne	kitne	hi	Ghaib	Batāne	Wāle	(Nabi)	agloñ	meiñ	bheje.

arabicText: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن نَّبِىٍّ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	whenever	any	Prophet	came	to	them,	they	only	mocked	at	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	ke	pās	jo	ghaib	batāne	wālā	(Nabi)	āayā	us	ki	hañsi	hi	banāyā	kiye

arabicText: فَأَهْلَكْنَآ أَشَدَّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًۭا وَمَضَىٰ مَثَلُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	therefore	destroyed	the	people	who	were	more	forceful	than	these,	and	the	example	of	the	
earlier	ones	has	already	gone	by.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Ham	ne	woh	halāk	kar	diye	jo	un	se	bhi	pakard	meiñ	sakht	they	aur	agloñ	kā	ḥāl	guzar	chuka	
hai.

arabicText: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ خَلَقَهُنَّ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	ask	them,	“Who	has	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth?”,	they	will	surely	say,	“They	
are	created	by	the	Most	Honourable,	the	All	Knowing.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	un	se	poocho	ke	āasmān	aur	zamin	kis	ne	banāye	to	zaroor		kaheñ	ge	unheñ	banāyā	
us	'izzat	wāle	'ilm	wāle	ne

arabicText: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ مَهْدًۭا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمْ فِيهَا سُبُلًۭا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText: The	One	Who	made	the	earth	a	bed	you,	and	made	roads	for	you	in	it,	so	that	you	may	be	guided.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	tumhāre	liye	zamin	ko	bichaunā	kiyā	aur	tumhāre	liye	us	meiñ	rāste	kiye	ke	tum	rāh	pāō.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِى نَزَّلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۢ بِقَدَرٍۢ فَأَنشَرْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةًۭ مَّيْتًۭا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Who	sent	down	water	from	the	sky	
with	a	proper	measure,	so	We	revived	a	
dead	city	with	it;	this	is	how	you	will	be	
taken	out.
romanUrduTranslationText:
And	Who	sent	down	water	from	the	sky	
with	a	proper	measure,	so	We	revived	a	
dead	city	with	it;	this	is	how	you	will	be	
taken	out.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِى نَزَّلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۢ بِقَدَرٍۢ فَأَنشَرْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةًۭ مَّيْتًۭا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ تُخْرَجُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Who	sent	down	water	from	the	sky	
with	a	proper	measure,	so	We	revived	a	
dead	city	with	it;	this	is	how	you	will	be	
taken	out.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jis	ne	āasmān	se	pāni	utārā	aik	
andāze	se	to	ham	ne	us	se	aik	murda	
shaher	zinda	farmā	diyā	yuñ	hi	tum	nikāle	
jāō	ge

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلْأَزْوَٰجَ كُلَّهَا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْفُلْكِ وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ مَا تَرْكَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	One	Who	created	all	pairs,	and	
made	the	ships	and	cattle	as	rides	for	you.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jis	ne	sab	jorde	banāye	aur	tumhāre	lie	
kashtiyoñ	aur	chaupāyoñ	se	suwāriyāñ	
banāyiñ

arabicText: لِتَسْتَوُۥا۟ عَلَىٰ ظُهُورِهِۦ ثُمَّ تَذْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَةَ رَبِّكُمْ إِذَا ٱسْتَوَيْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَتَقُولُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ لَنَا هَـٰذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لَهُۥ مُقْرِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	that	you	may	properly	mount	their	
backs,	and	may	remember	your	Lord’s	
favour	when	you	have	mounted	them,	and	
say,	“Purity	is	to	Him,	Who	has	given	this	
ride	in	our	control,	and	we	did	not	have	the	
strength	for	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	tum	un	ki	peethoñ	par	thik	baitho	phir	
apne	Rab	ki	n'emat	yād	karo	jab	us	par	thik	
baith	lo	aur	yuñ	kaho	pāki	hai	usey	jis	ne	is	
suwāri	ko	hāmare	bas	meiñ	kar	diyā	aur	
yeh	hamāre	boote	(qābo)	ki	na	thi.

arabicText: وَإِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا لَمُنقَلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	we	have	to	return	to	our	
Lord.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hameñ	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	
palatnā	hai

arabicText: وَجَعَلُوا۟ لَهُۥ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ جُزْءًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ لَكَفُورٌۭ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	from	His	bondmen,	they	appointed	a	
portion	for	Him;	man	is	indeed	an	open	
ingrate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke	liye	us	ke	bandoñ	se	tukdā	
thahrāyā	be-shak	āadmi	khulā	nā-shukrā	
hai

arabicText: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ بَنَاتٍۢ وَأَصْفَىٰكُم بِٱلْبَنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Has	He	chosen	daughters	for	Himself	from	
His	creation,	and	selected	only	sons	for	
you?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiyā	us	ne	apne	liye	apni	makhloq	meiñ	se	
betiyāñ	liñ	aur	tumheñ	betoñ	ke	sāth	khās	
kiyā

arabicText: وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِمَا ضَرَبَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مَثَلًۭا ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُۥ مُسْوَدًّۭا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	one	of	them	is	given	the	glad	tidings	
of	what	he	professes	regarding	the	Most	
Gracious,	his	face	blackens	and	he	is	
mournful!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	meiñ	kisi	ko	khush	khabri	di	
jāye	us	chiz	ki	jis	kā	wasf	Raḥmān	ke	liye	
batā	chuka	hai	to	din	bhar	us	kā	muñh	kālā	
rahe	aur	gham	khāyā	kare

arabicText: أَوَمَن يُنَشَّؤُا۟ فِى ٱلْحِلْيَةِ وَهُوَ فِى ٱلْخِصَامِ غَيْرُ مُبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	(do	they	chose	for	Him)	one	who	is	
brought	up	among	ornaments,	and	cannot	
express	herself	clearly	in	debate?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kiyā	woh	jo	gahne	(zewar)	meiñ	
parwān	chadhe	aur	baḥas	meiñ	sāf	bāt	na	
kare

arabicText: وَجَعَلُوا۟ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ عِبَـٰدُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ إِنَـٰثًا ۚ أَشَهِدُوا۟ خَلْقَهُمْ ۚ سَتُكْتَبُ شَهَـٰدَتُهُمْ وَيُسْـَٔلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	appoint	the	angels,	who	are	the	bondmen	of	the	Most	Gracious,	as	females;	were	they	
present	at	the	time	of	the	angels’	creation?	Their	declaration	will	be	now	recorded	and	they	will	
be	questioned.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unhoñ	ne	Farishtoñ	ko	ki	Raḥmān	ke	bande	haiñ	'aurateñ	thahrāyā	kyā	un	ke	banāte	waqt	
yeh	ḥāzir	they	ab	likh	li	jāye	gi	un	ki	gawāhi	aur	un	se	jawāb	ṭalab	hogā

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ لَوْ شَآءَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ مَا عَبَدْنَـٰهُم ۗ مَّا لَهُم بِذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَخْرُصُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	say,	“If	the	Most	Gracious	had	willed,	we	would	not	have	worshipped	them!”	They	do	
not	know	its	truth	at	all;	they	only	make	guesses.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	agar	Raḥmān	chahtā	ham	unheñ	na	poojte	unheñ	us	ki	ḥaqiqat	kuch	m'alom	nahiñ	yuñ	
hi	atkaleñ	daudāte	haiñ

arabicText: أَمْ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ كِتَـٰبًۭا مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ فَهُم بِهِۦ مُسْتَمْسِكُونَ
englishTranslationText: Or	have	We	given	them	some	Book	before	this,	to	which	they	hold	fast?
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	is	se	qabl	Ham	ne	unheñ	koyi	Kitāb	di	hai	jise	woh	thāme	huye	haiñ

arabicText: بَلْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا عَلَىٰٓ أُمَّةٍۢ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِم مُّهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText: Rather	they	said,	“We	found	our	forefathers	upon	a	religion,	and	we	are	following	their	footsteps.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	bole	ham	ne	apne	bāp	dada	ko	aik	din	par	pāyā	aur	ham	un	ki	lakeer	par	chal	rahe	haiñ

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِى قَرْيَةٍۢ مِّن نَّذِيرٍ إِلَّا قَالَ مُتْرَفُوهَآ إِنَّا وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا عَلَىٰٓ أُمَّةٍۢ وَإِنَّا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَـٰرِهِم مُّقْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	similarly,	whenever	We	sent	a	Herald	
of	Warning	before	you	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	into	any	town,	its	wealthy	people	
said,	“We	found	our	forefathers	upon	a	
religion,	and	we	are	following	their	
footsteps.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aise	hi	Ham	ne	tum	se	pahle	jab	kisi	
shaher	meiñ	koyi	dar	sunāne	wālā	bhejā	
wahāñ	ke	āsudoñ	(māldāroñ)	ne	yahi	kahā	
ke	ham	ne	apne	bāp	dādā	ko	aik	deen	par	
pāyā	aur	ham	un	ki	lakir	ke	piche	haiñ
